storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review and act on schedule change requests to ensure proper authorization

testCases.title: Validate approver can view and act on pending requests
preconditions: Approver user account exists with valid credentials
Approver has been assigned the 'Approver' role in the system
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Schedule change request has been submitted by an employee
System is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid approver credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and redirected to the home page or dashboard

steps.action: Click on the 'Approval Dashboard' or 'Pending Approvals' menu option in the navigation
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard page loads and displays a list of all pending schedule change requests assigned to the logged-in approver with columns showing request ID, employee name, request date, and current status

steps.action: Select a pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying complete information including employee details, requested schedule changes, reason for change, submission date, and any attached supporting documents

steps.action: Review all request details and attachments, then click the 'Approve' button
steps.expectedResult: A comment box appears prompting the approver to add optional comments

steps.action: Enter approval comments in the comment box (e.g., 'Approved as requested. Schedule change is justified.') and click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Approval' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the approval action, request status updates to 'Approved', a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Request has been successfully approved'), and the approver is redirected back to the approval dashboard

steps.action: Verify the approved request no longer appears in the pending requests list
steps.expectedResult: The approved request is removed from the pending list or moved to an 'Approved' section, confirming the status change

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Approval action is logged with timestamp and approver details
Employee who submitted the request receives notification of approval
Request is removed from approver's pending queue
Audit trail is created for the approval action

testCases.title: Verify rejection and request for additional information actions
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate role-based permissions
Multiple pending schedule change requests exist in the system
Approver is on the approval dashboard page
System notification service is operational

steps.action: From the approval dashboard, select a pending schedule change request by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying all relevant information including employee name, requested changes, reason, submission date, and attachments

steps.action: Review the request details and click the 'Reject' button
steps.expectedResult: A comment box appears requiring the approver to provide a reason for rejection

steps.action: Enter rejection comments in the comment box (e.g., 'Request denied due to insufficient staffing coverage during requested period.') and click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Rejection' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the rejection, request status updates to 'Rejected', a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Request has been rejected'), and notification is queued to be sent to the requester

steps.action: Verify the rejection notification was sent by checking the notification log or system activity
steps.expectedResult: System log shows notification was successfully sent to the employee with rejection status and comments

steps.action: Navigate back to the approval dashboard and select another pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: A different pending request details page opens with all relevant information displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Request Additional Information' or 'Request More Info' button
steps.expectedResult: A comment box appears prompting the approver to specify what additional information is needed

steps.action: Enter specific information request in the comment box (e.g., 'Please provide manager approval and detailed justification for the extended leave period.') and click 'Submit'
steps.expectedResult: System updates request status to 'Additional Information Required' or 'Pending Employee Response', confirmation message is displayed, and notification is queued to be sent to the requester

steps.action: Verify the requester receives notification with the information request
steps.expectedResult: System log confirms notification was delivered to the employee with status update and specific information requirements

postconditions: First request status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
Second request status is updated to 'Additional Information Required'
Both actions are logged with timestamps and approver details
Employees receive appropriate notifications for their respective requests
Rejected request is moved out of pending queue
Request requiring more info remains accessible to employee for updates
Audit trail is created for both actions

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot perform approval actions
preconditions: Non-approver user account exists (regular employee without approver role)
Non-approver user is logged into the system
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Role-based access control is configured and active
API endpoints for approval actions are protected

steps.action: As a non-approver user, attempt to navigate to the approval dashboard by entering the URL directly (e.g., /approvals/dashboard) or clicking on approval menu if visible
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this page' or 'Unauthorized Access' and redirects user to home page or displays 403 Forbidden error

steps.action: Attempt to access the API endpoint directly by sending a GET request to /api/approvals/pending using browser developer tools or API testing tool
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Obtain a valid schedule change request ID and attempt to access the approval action endpoint by sending a POST request to /api/approvals/{requestId}/action with action payload (e.g., {"action": "approve", "comments": "test"})
steps.expectedResult: API rejects the request with 403 Forbidden status code and returns error message such as 'You are not authorized to perform approval actions'

steps.action: Verify the unauthorized access attempt is logged in the system security log
steps.expectedResult: System security log contains entry showing the unauthorized access attempt with timestamp, user ID, attempted action, and denial reason

steps.action: Check the schedule change request status in the database
steps.expectedResult: Request status remains unchanged at 'Pending' and no approval action record was created, confirming the unauthorized attempt had no effect

steps.action: As a non-approver, attempt to manipulate request parameters or session tokens to bypass authorization and submit an approval action
steps.expectedResult: System validates user permissions server-side, rejects the action regardless of client-side manipulation, returns appropriate error message, and logs the security violation attempt

postconditions: No schedule change request statuses were modified
No approval actions were recorded in the database
All unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit trail
System security remains intact with no unauthorized data access
Non-approver user permissions remain unchanged
Alert may be generated for security team if multiple unauthorized attempts detected

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications about my schedule change request status to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate notification sent upon schedule change request submission
preconditions: Employee user account exists and is active
Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has permission to submit schedule change requests
Notification service is operational and configured
Employee email address is registered in the system
In-app notification center is functional

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request form by clicking on 'Request Schedule Change' or similar menu option
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form loads with all required fields displayed (date range, reason, attachments, etc.)

steps.action: Fill in all required fields: select date range for schedule change, enter reason for request (e.g., 'Personal appointment'), attach any supporting documents if needed, and click 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form validation passes, request is successfully submitted, and a confirmation message appears (e.g., 'Your schedule change request has been submitted successfully')

steps.action: Check for immediate notification delivery by observing the notification icon or badge in the application header
steps.expectedResult: Notification icon shows a new notification indicator (e.g., red badge with number '1' or notification bell animation)

steps.action: Click on the notification icon or navigate to the notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification center opens displaying the submission confirmation notification with details including request ID, submission timestamp, and message such as 'Your schedule change request #12345 has been submitted and is pending approval'

steps.action: Verify notification details include correct request information: request ID, submission date/time, requested schedule change dates, and current status ('Submitted' or 'Pending Approval')
steps.expectedResult: All notification details match the submitted request information accurately, including request ID, dates, and status

steps.action: Check employee's registered email inbox for submission confirmation email
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received with subject line such as 'Schedule Change Request Submitted - Request #12345' containing the same details as in-app notification and next steps information

steps.action: Verify the notification timestamp shows it was sent immediately after submission
steps.expectedResult: Notification timestamp is within 1 minute of the request submission time

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in the database with 'Pending' status
Submission notification is stored in notification history
Email notification is sent to employee's registered email address
In-app notification is visible in employee's notification center
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Request is queued for approver review

testCases.title: Verify notifications sent upon approval and rejection
preconditions: Employee has submitted at least two schedule change requests
Both requests are in 'Pending' status
Approver user is logged into the system
Notification service is operational
Employee notification center is accessible
Employee email is configured and deliverable

steps.action: As an approver, navigate to the approval dashboard and select the first pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing all information about the employee's schedule change request

steps.action: Review the request details and click 'Approve' button, add comments (e.g., 'Approved as requested'), and submit the approval
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Approved', confirmation message is displayed, and approval action is processed by the system

steps.action: Log out from approver account and log in as the employee who submitted the request
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and is directed to the employee dashboard

steps.action: Check the notification icon or badge in the application header
steps.expectedResult: Notification indicator shows a new unread notification (e.g., badge with number or highlighted icon)

steps.action: Click on the notification icon to open the notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification center displays the approval notification with message such as 'Your schedule change request #12345 has been approved' including approver comments, approval date/time, and next steps

steps.action: Verify the approval notification contains complete details: request ID, approval status, approver name, approval timestamp, comments, and any next steps or actions required
steps.expectedResult: All details are present and accurate, matching the approval action taken by the approver

steps.action: Check employee's email inbox for approval notification email
steps.expectedResult: Email is received with subject like 'Schedule Change Request Approved - Request #12345' containing approval details and approver comments

steps.action: Log out from employee account and log back in as approver
steps.expectedResult: Approver successfully logs in and accesses the approval dashboard

steps.action: Select the second pending schedule change request from the same employee
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens with all information displayed

steps.action: Click 'Reject' button, enter rejection reason in comments (e.g., 'Unable to approve due to staffing constraints during requested period'), and submit the rejection
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Rejected', confirmation message is displayed, and rejection action is processed

steps.action: Log out from approver account and log back in as the employee
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and notification indicator shows new notification

steps.action: Open the notification center and locate the rejection notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification center displays the rejection notification with message such as 'Your schedule change request #12346 has been rejected' including rejection reason, approver comments, and guidance on next steps (e.g., 'You may submit a new request with different dates')

steps.action: Verify the rejection notification contains complete details: request ID, rejection status, approver name, rejection timestamp, detailed comments explaining the reason, and available options
steps.expectedResult: All details are present, accurate, and provide clear information about why the request was rejected

steps.action: Check employee's email inbox for rejection notification email
steps.expectedResult: Email is received with subject like 'Schedule Change Request Rejected - Request #12346' containing rejection details and approver's explanation

postconditions: First request status is 'Approved' in the database
Second request status is 'Rejected' in the database
Both approval and rejection notifications are stored in notification history
Employee has received both in-app and email notifications for both actions
All notifications are logged with delivery timestamps
Employee can view complete notification history in the application
Audit trail exists for both approval and rejection actions

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are delivered within 1 minute of status change
preconditions: Employee has submitted a schedule change request in 'Pending' status
Approver is logged into the system
Notification service is running and operational
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Employee notification center is accessible
Test environment allows for timestamp verification

steps.action: Note the current system time before initiating the status change action
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded (e.g., 2024-01-15 10:30:00)

steps.action: As an approver, navigate to the approval dashboard and select a pending schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying the pending request information

steps.action: Click 'Approve' button, add comments, and click 'Submit' to change the request status to 'Approved', then immediately note the exact timestamp of submission
steps.expectedResult: Request is approved, confirmation message appears, and approval timestamp is recorded (e.g., 2024-01-15 10:30:15)

steps.action: Immediately switch to the employee account (or have a second browser/session already logged in as the employee) and refresh the notification center
steps.expectedResult: Notification center refreshes and displays notifications

steps.action: Check for the approval notification and note its delivery timestamp shown in the notification
steps.expectedResult: Approval notification is visible in the notification center with a timestamp indicating when it was delivered

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between the status change timestamp (approval submission) and the notification delivery timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is 60 seconds or less (e.g., if approval was at 10:30:15 and notification shows 10:30:45, difference is 30 seconds)

steps.action: Check the system notification log or database to verify the exact notification creation and delivery timestamps
steps.expectedResult: System log shows notification was created and queued immediately after status change, and delivery timestamp confirms it was sent within 1 minute

steps.action: Verify email notification delivery time by checking email headers or system email log
steps.expectedResult: Email notification was sent within 1 minute of the status change, as confirmed by email timestamp or system email delivery log

steps.action: Repeat the test with a rejection action: have approver reject another pending request and measure notification delivery time
steps.expectedResult: Rejection notification is also delivered within 1 minute of status change, confirming consistent performance across different status types

steps.action: Review notification service performance metrics or logs to confirm no delays or queuing issues
steps.expectedResult: Service logs show notification processing time is well within the 1-minute requirement with no errors or delays

postconditions: All notifications were delivered within the 1-minute SLA
Notification delivery timestamps are logged in the system
Performance metrics confirm notification service is meeting requirements
No notification delivery failures occurred during the test
Employee received timely updates for all status changes
System performance logs show acceptable processing times

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view reports on schedule change approvals to monitor workflow efficiency

testCases.title: Validate report generation with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Manager has authorization to access reporting portal
Schedule change approval data exists in the system (at least 10 records)
Multiple departments have schedule change requests in the system
Date range covers at least 30 days of historical data

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reporting portal from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting portal homepage loads successfully within 3 seconds

steps.action: Manager clicks on 'Schedule Change Approval Reports' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Reporting dashboard is displayed with default view showing all available data, filter options are visible on the left panel, and initial charts/tables render correctly

steps.action: Manager selects a specific department from the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and highlighted, report begins to refresh with loading indicator

steps.action: Manager selects a date range (e.g., last 30 days) using the date range picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied and displayed, report updates to reflect both department and date range filters within 5 seconds

steps.action: Manager reviews the updated charts section displaying approval metrics
steps.expectedResult: Charts render correctly showing approval times, volumes, and statuses with accurate data matching the applied filters, visual elements are clear and properly labeled

steps.action: Manager scrolls down to view the data tables section
steps.expectedResult: Data tables display detailed records with columns for request ID, employee name, submission date, approval date, status, and approver name. Data is accurate and matches the filtered criteria

steps.action: Manager verifies the total count of records displayed matches the filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: Record count is accurate and displayed prominently, pagination controls are visible if records exceed page limit

postconditions: Report remains in filtered state for current session
Filter selections are preserved if manager navigates away and returns
System logs the report generation activity for audit purposes

testCases.title: Verify report export functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Manager is on the schedule change approval reports dashboard
A report has been generated with at least 5 records
Browser allows file downloads
PDF reader and Excel application are available on the test machine

steps.action: Manager applies desired filters and generates a report with visible data
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed with charts, tables, and data matching the filter criteria

steps.action: Manager locates and clicks the 'Export' button in the report toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Export options dropdown menu appears showing 'Export as PDF' and 'Export as Excel' options

steps.action: Manager selects 'Export as PDF' from the dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates with a progress indicator, PDF file is generated and downloaded to the default downloads folder within 10 seconds, filename includes report type and timestamp

steps.action: Manager opens the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens correctly in the default PDF reader, contains all report data including charts and tables, formatting is preserved, data is readable and matches the on-screen report

steps.action: Manager returns to the reporting dashboard and clicks the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options dropdown menu appears again

steps.action: Manager selects 'Export as Excel' from the dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates with a progress indicator, Excel file (.xlsx) is generated and downloaded to the default downloads folder within 10 seconds, filename includes report type and timestamp

steps.action: Manager opens the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens correctly in the spreadsheet application, contains all report data in structured format with proper column headers, data is accurate and matches the on-screen report, charts are included as embedded objects or separate sheets

postconditions: Two export files (PDF and Excel) are saved in the downloads folder
Export activity is logged in the system audit trail
Report remains displayed on screen in its current state
Manager can continue working with the report or export again

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access reports
preconditions: User is logged in with a non-manager role (e.g., Employee or Approver without manager privileges)
Role-based access control is properly configured in the system
Reporting dashboard URL is known or accessible via navigation

steps.action: Non-manager user attempts to navigate to the reporting portal from the main dashboard menu
steps.expectedResult: Reporting portal option is either not visible in the navigation menu or is displayed as disabled/grayed out

steps.action: Non-manager user attempts to directly access the reporting dashboard by entering the URL in the browser address bar (e.g., /reports/schedule-change-approvals)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied immediately, user is redirected to an error page or unauthorized access page

steps.action: Non-manager user views the error message displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Appropriate error message is displayed stating 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this page' or similar message, HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned

steps.action: Non-manager user attempts to access the reporting API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client (GET /api/reports/schedule-change-approvals)
steps.expectedResult: API request is rejected with 403 Forbidden status code, error response includes message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Non-manager user verifies they can still access other authorized areas of the application
steps.expectedResult: User can successfully navigate to and access pages and features appropriate for their role without any issues

postconditions: Non-manager user remains on an authorized page or error page
No report data is exposed or accessible to the unauthorized user
Access attempt is logged in the security audit trail with user ID, timestamp, and denied action
System security remains intact with no unauthorized access granted

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to request additional information on schedule change requests to make informed decisions

testCases.title: Validate approver can request additional information
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role credentials
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Approver has permission to review and act on the schedule change request
Employee who submitted the request has a valid email address and notification preferences enabled
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Approver navigates to the pending schedule change requests queue from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: List of pending schedule change requests is displayed with request IDs, employee names, submission dates, and current status

steps.action: Approver clicks on a specific schedule change request to view details
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens displaying full information including employee name, requested schedule changes, reason for change, submission date, and available action buttons (Approve, Reject, Request Additional Information)

steps.action: Approver reviews the request details and identifies missing or unclear information
steps.expectedResult: All current request information is clearly displayed and readable

steps.action: Approver clicks the 'Request Additional Information' button
steps.expectedResult: A modal dialog or form appears with a text area for entering comments and a field to specify what additional information is needed

steps.action: Approver enters detailed comments in the text area specifying the required information (e.g., 'Please provide the business justification for this schedule change and confirm coverage for your current shift')
steps.expectedResult: Text is entered successfully in the comment field, character count is displayed if there is a limit, field validation shows no errors

steps.action: Approver clicks the 'Submit Request' button in the modal dialog
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, success message appears confirming 'Additional information request has been sent to the employee', request status updates from 'Pending' to 'Information Requested' or 'Pending Additional Info'

steps.action: Approver verifies the request status has been updated in the request details page
steps.expectedResult: Request status badge displays 'Information Requested', approver's comment is visible in the request history/timeline section with timestamp and approver name

steps.action: Approver checks that a notification has been sent to the employee
steps.expectedResult: System confirmation indicates notification was sent successfully within 1 minute, notification appears in the employee's notification center (can be verified by checking employee account or notification logs)

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Information Requested'
Employee receives notification via email and in-app notification center
Approver's comment and action are logged in the audit trail with timestamp
Request remains in approver's queue but is marked as awaiting employee response
Request cannot be approved or rejected until additional information is provided

testCases.title: Verify employee can respond to additional information requests
preconditions: User is logged in with Employee role credentials
Employee has a schedule change request with status 'Information Requested'
Approver has previously requested additional information with specific comments
Employee has access to notification center
Employee has permission to edit their own schedule change requests

steps.action: Employee logs into the system and views the notification center icon/badge
steps.expectedResult: Notification center icon displays a badge indicating unread notifications (e.g., red dot or number)

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification center icon to open the notification panel
steps.expectedResult: Notification panel opens displaying list of notifications, notification for additional information request is visible at the top with title 'Additional Information Required for Schedule Change Request #[ID]'

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification for the additional information request
steps.expectedResult: Employee is redirected to the schedule change request details page, notification is marked as read, request status shows 'Information Requested', approver's comments requesting additional information are prominently displayed

steps.action: Employee reviews the approver's comments to understand what information is needed
steps.expectedResult: Approver's comments are clearly visible with timestamp and approver name, employee can read the specific information being requested

steps.action: Employee clicks the 'Update Request' or 'Provide Additional Information' button
steps.expectedResult: Request edit form opens with existing request details pre-populated, additional text area or fields are available for adding the requested information

steps.action: Employee enters the required additional information in the designated field (e.g., adds business justification and shift coverage details)
steps.expectedResult: Text is entered successfully, field validation passes, employee can see their updates in real-time

steps.action: Employee clicks the 'Submit Updates' or 'Resubmit Request' button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, success message appears confirming 'Your updates have been submitted and the approver has been notified', request status changes from 'Information Requested' to 'Pending' or 'Under Review'

steps.action: Employee verifies the updated information is saved and visible in the request details
steps.expectedResult: Updated information is displayed in the request details, update timestamp is shown, employee's response is added to the request history/timeline

steps.action: System sends notification to the approver about the updated information
steps.expectedResult: Approver receives notification within 1 minute via email and in-app notification indicating the employee has provided the requested information

postconditions: Schedule change request is updated with additional information provided by employee
Request status is changed back to 'Pending' or 'Under Review'
Approver receives notification about the update
Employee's response is logged in the audit trail with timestamp
Request returns to approver's queue for review
Notification is marked as read in employee's notification center

testCases.title: Ensure audit trail of information requests and responses
preconditions: User is logged in with appropriate role to access audit logs (Manager or System Administrator)
At least one schedule change request exists with a complete cycle of information request and response
Approver has requested additional information on the schedule change request
Employee has responded with the requested information
Audit logging is enabled in the system
User has permission to view audit trails

steps.action: User navigates to the audit log or system logs section from the admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully with search and filter options available

steps.action: User enters the schedule change request ID in the search field or filters by request ID
steps.expectedResult: Search executes successfully, audit log entries related to the specific schedule change request are displayed

steps.action: User reviews the audit log entries for the information request action
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains an entry for 'Additional Information Requested' action with details including: timestamp of when approver requested information, approver's user ID and name, request ID, approver's comments/message, status change from 'Pending' to 'Information Requested'

steps.action: User reviews the audit log entries for the employee's response action
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains an entry for 'Additional Information Provided' action with details including: timestamp of when employee responded, employee's user ID and name, request ID, employee's response/updated information, status change from 'Information Requested' to 'Pending'

steps.action: User verifies the chronological order of audit entries
steps.expectedResult: Audit entries are displayed in chronological order showing the complete sequence: initial request submission, information request by approver, employee response, and any subsequent actions

steps.action: User checks for notification-related audit entries
steps.expectedResult: Audit log includes entries for notifications sent: notification to employee when information was requested, notification to approver when employee responded, timestamps confirm notifications were sent within 1 minute of the triggering action

steps.action: User verifies all audit entries contain required metadata
steps.expectedResult: Each audit entry includes: unique audit log ID, timestamp (date and time), user ID and name of actor, action type, request ID, before and after status values, IP address or session information, any relevant comments or data changes

steps.action: User attempts to export the audit trail for the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Export option is available, audit trail can be exported in a standard format (CSV, PDF, or Excel), exported file contains all audit entries with complete information

postconditions: Complete audit trail is preserved in the system database
All information requests and responses are permanently logged
Audit logs remain immutable and cannot be edited or deleted by unauthorized users
Audit trail is available for compliance and reporting purposes
User can access the audit trail again for future reference

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to filter and search schedule change requests to efficiently manage approvals

testCases.title: Validate filtering of schedule change requests by status and date
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role credentials
Approver has access to the approval dashboard
Multiple schedule change requests exist in the system with varying statuses (pending, approved, rejected)
Schedule change requests exist across different date ranges
Database contains at least 10 schedule change requests for testing

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate and click on the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter dropdown expands showing available status options (pending, approved, rejected, all)

steps.action: Select 'Pending' from the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter is set to 'Pending' and the selection is visually indicated

steps.action: Click on the date range filter and select a start date and end date
steps.expectedResult: Date range picker opens, allows selection of dates, and displays the selected date range

steps.action: Click 'Apply' or 'Filter' button to apply the selected filters
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list displays only schedule change requests with 'Pending' status within the selected date range. Results are returned within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the filtered results by checking each displayed request
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests have 'Pending' status and submission dates fall within the selected date range

steps.action: Click on 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: All applied filters are removed and filter controls return to default state

steps.action: Observe the request list after clearing filters
steps.expectedResult: Full list of all schedule change requests is displayed without any filtering applied

postconditions: All filters are cleared and system is in default state
Full unfiltered list of schedule change requests is visible
No filter presets are saved during this test

testCases.title: Verify keyword search functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role credentials
Approver has access to the approval dashboard
Multiple schedule change requests exist in the system
Schedule change requests are associated with different employee names
At least one employee named 'John Smith' has submitted schedule change requests

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate the search box on the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Search box is visible and active with placeholder text indicating search functionality

steps.action: Click inside the search box to focus on it
steps.expectedResult: Search box is focused and cursor is blinking, ready for text input

steps.action: Type 'John Smith' in the search box
steps.expectedResult: Text 'John Smith' appears in the search box as it is typed

steps.action: Observe the request list as the keyword is entered
steps.expectedResult: List updates dynamically to show only schedule change requests where employee name matches 'John Smith'. Results are returned within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify each displayed request contains the search keyword
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests are associated with employee 'John Smith' and the keyword is highlighted or clearly visible

steps.action: Clear the search box by deleting the text or clicking a clear icon
steps.expectedResult: Search box is cleared and full list of schedule change requests is restored

postconditions: Search box is cleared
Full unfiltered list of schedule change requests is displayed
System is ready for next search operation

testCases.title: Ensure saved filter presets function correctly
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role credentials
Approver has access to the approval dashboard
Multiple schedule change requests exist with varying statuses and dates
No existing filter presets are saved for this approver
System supports saving and loading filter presets

steps.action: Navigate to the approval dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Approval dashboard loads successfully displaying all schedule change requests

steps.action: Apply multiple filters: select 'Pending' status and set date range to last 7 days
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and list displays only pending requests from the last 7 days

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Save Filter' or 'Save Preset' button
steps.expectedResult: A dialog or input field appears prompting for preset name

steps.action: Enter preset name 'Pending Last Week' and click 'Save' or 'Confirm'
steps.expectedResult: Preset is saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the saved preset appears in the presets list or dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Preset 'Pending Last Week' is visible and selectable in the saved presets section

steps.action: Clear all current filters to return to default view
steps.expectedResult: All filters are cleared and full list of requests is displayed

steps.action: Click on or select the saved preset 'Pending Last Week' from the presets list
